content: Works great, very useful for video and photography There is an option for custom format which allows precise preview for cameras not yet listed. I hope the Fuji Gfx100 can be added in a future update, for now the PhaseOne P30+ has a near identical 4:3 sensor for photography and the Custom sensor can be set to the DCI 4k format of the GFX.
This is a good app but from pro version i was expecting features to record video as well.. Suggestion= Please add features to select Wide angle camera from Multicam setup phone*
replyContent: Thanks for your review. I usually expect people who are about to make a purchase to first try the free version, and then second read carefully what they will be paying for. Sorry, no video recording at this moment

content: Perfect app. must need for every photographer.

Functionally very useful. I wish there was an option to turn off the haptic feedback, the constant vibrating when changing focal lengths is incredibly distracting. (Edit, thanks for the tip! Very happy)
replyContent: Hi there, thanks for your review! Haptics are adjustable in the Settings menu. Just press the upper right image of a camera :)

content: Looks very handy - I like the idea of checking out a shot idea without having to unpack all my lenses. On the other hand, it's a pity there is (as far as I can see) no option to make the area outside the chosen focal frame transparent. I want to mount my phone above the camera so I can see whether my shot is about to be photo-bombed by a stray bird!
replyContent: "option to make the area outside the chosen focal frame transparent." -- what do you mean by that, Michael? UPD Oh, I can see what you mean. That feature you are talking about is not coming soon, sorry for that

content: Super useful when finding the right lens for a frame
replyContent: Thank you so much!

content: Great app, would be perfect if it catered also to tiny-sensor cameras. I can specify a 1/2.3" sensor size once I've calculated it in mm, but the app doesn't allow lenses with focal lengths below 7mm. Most minicams have lenses around 2-4mm. Probably not much market for this, but it'd certainly help me out when trying to match minicam shots to those on larger sensors (despite depth of field difference). Thinking about it, I guess my phone sensor wouldn't be able to replicate such a wide angle...
replyContent: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. 2-4mm focal length would not be super wide because of the small sensor size. The problem with the low focal length would be that it stretch the lower part of the wheel disproportionately.

content: Well designed and intuitive. Best viewfinder app on Android that ive used.

content: It works. That's a good start. I'd like it to support my second and third camera through. I'm on a Xiaomi 9t. Is it possible to have a toggle just like when switching the front and back camera?
replyContent: The button to switch the front and back camera usually works with all other cameras, like ultra wide (see this http://dev.kadru.net/index.php/2020/04/05/faq-android/ ) Let me know if you still have the problem

content: Great little tool for composing and talking to my crew. Reccomend buying over the other versions because you never know what camera you may come across in your career. Would love to see more professional cameras Sony Venice, Panasonic S1H or Varicam. Also a function to photo stitch when the lens goes wider than the cameras point of view but I realise that would take so much more thinking time for the phone to do.
replyContent: Thanks for your kind words, Daniel. Happy shooting and stay safe! UPD For the ultra wide angles may I suggest wide optical adapters that clip-on to the smartphone? Cheap and effective UPD Cameras Sony Venice, Panasonic S1H and Varicam are added. Enjoy!

content: This app will come in handy in the future. Which wide lens adapter do you recommend?
replyContent: Depends on your phone and its camera lens size. Also  it depends on what quality you expect from the lens. Cheap wide lens adapter from China costs about $6-8 but the visual quality of the image deteriorates. Amazon has a wide selection.

content: great for storyboarding and test shoots without having the actual equipment

content: After having tested this side by side with other popular apps in the market, I can honestly say it's really worth more than what you have to pay for it. Doesn't lack a single feature and has top notch support. Big thumbs up!!

This is a great app. I've tried several other "director's viewfinder" type apps and this is the best. The others are all too fiddly to setup and to use. I particularly like the quick selection of focal lengths which I've customised to suit my range of lenses and the support for the micro four thirds format sensor. This app is very handy to use when I'm out and about scouting locations and the geotagging option is particularly useful to help me remember where a shot was taken.    The DOF fleld function is also a very nice addition to the app. I don't use the LUT function except that it can be useful to have it enabled and take a monochrome shot.  The quick change of aspect ratio is also a nice feature.  A couple of quick suggestions if I may. I bought the paid version particularly because of it making it harder to accidentally trigger deletion of preset focal lengths, please can you make this process harder as I still accidentally press in the wrong place. Also would you consider the inclusion of rule of thirds and particularly golden ration overlay grids in a future version.  Thanks for a great app and kind regards. Thanks for the latest update Roman, the best just got better!
replyContent: Thanks so much for the detailed review! I'll consider your suggestions, thanks! Would you care to drop me a letter to dev@kadru.net? I need more details on the options you mentioned

content: Very best app!!!
Nice app. Thnx for development.
replyContent: Thanks for your review!

content: Very useful,👍

content: Very useful. Will force everyone at Met Film School London to use it. Thank you for not over charging your app. A true life saver! (But why not invest in a more professional looking icon, Roman?)

content: Use it constantly on set with director,  and  also every other department for crystal clear communication of shot setups.  A great scouting tool too. content: Definitely a "must have" for directors and cinematographers. Well done, really.

content: I use this on every shoot. Feels faster and more "native" than other viewfinder apps. Easy to use, and also includes a helpful DoF calculator. The only thing I miss from Artemis/Cadrage is the ability to save lens packages and see an overview of the different FOVs afforded by your selected lenses.
I've tried the others, all of them, and they are clumsy and fidgety when compared to this app. Everything works here, in a simple and intuitive way, and the inbuilt dof bit is genius.
Great app. if you have a Black Magic Pocket camera you need this app! I have used it on acouple of shoots. It has proven its worth many times over.

Cleverly designed to be a simple but yet very effective and powerful app. Very easy to use and understand and a MUST HAVE for BMC owners. Roman, your work and your dedication on improving this app and listening to customers is something that a whole lot of people should learn from.
